name: Curse of Mermos
description: Curse of Mermos is a free, lighthearted hack and slash game with fast paced action and challenging combat. Players wield the Hammer of Horus or shoot the Crossbow of Neith to defeat hordes of monsters in the tomb of Ebo. The game features unlock-able abilities and skill upgrades for personalized combat.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: Intel Dual Core or equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA Storage: 250 MB available space Additional Notes: Gamepad highly recommended

reviews.review_text: The game is fun, free, but most importantly, very difficult.  As you progress through the game, you will encounter more and more difficult enemies. For example, an enemy you can't hit, until it slams it's shield onto the ground. However, once those same shield enemies clump together, it becomes very difficult to kill them. There are also enemies that heal their allies, two different ranged attackers, an enemy that rolls near you, in droves, and blows up, an enemy that throws flame AoE at you, and small critters.  The game became very fustrating towards the end, which was at wave 29-30. You are expected to retrieve 3,000 souls, which is a lot. You will be engulfed in flames, shield slammers, enemy healers, and lots of explosive enemies.   I was terribly, terribly destroyed and I ended up quitting on my 5th try on completing the wave, where I must retrieve the 3,000 souls. I have yet to complete the game.  I do not recommend this game to casuals, but those who are willing to experience a game that will challenge their gamer minds.

By killing the small things. Overview:  Curse of Mermos is a fun little hack/slash/shooting game. You basically play as a mummies ♥♥♥♥♥ collecting items and killing relentless wave after wave. The objective is simple - collect the souls, make yourself stronger, and continue to collect more souls.  Pros: 1. It's completely free, not even an in game option to buy anything with real currency. 2. The controls are simple. 3. Graphics are clean and cute. 4. Low Requirements. 5. Combat is fair, nothing too ridiculously unfair/annoying.  Cons:  1. Buggy/Glitchy; you can roll through/out of walls and sometimes shots go through an enemy, like the exploding enemies and scarabs. 2. Upgrade system/Glyph system while nice, are very limited and few options. 3. Soul collection radius is low, even with the glyph that increases radius. (You basically have to walk over each tiny soul)  4. There's no saved progression... (Main reason I'm giving a negative review) 5. Gets repetitive as there's only one map you're ever on.  End Note: I'm not sure why people complain so much about the controls... I got to wave 28 in about an hour and a half using keyboard/mouse. While it would be easier to aim with a joystick - strafe has a 'lock on target' type of effect which means you don't really have to aim yourself. After I reached wave 28 I exited to try and re-open with a lower resolution, because there were a lot of monsters in the wave and I wanted to make sure it was as smooth as possible... when I got back on I was level 1 again. Maybe you're into restarting/starting over, however I enjoy progression and with 0 save option it really left a poor taste in my mouth. If you're looking to kill time once or twice this would be the game for you.
